revised_title: The Peculiar Property of Egg Albumen in Resisting Freezing
tldr: The author investigates the freezing properties of egg albumen and discovers that fresh eggs can resist freezing longer than others due to the unique properties of their albumen. This resistance is not due to vital properties, but rather the mechanical properties of the albumen. The author also finds that other substances do not possess this property, suggesting it is an adaptation to preserve eggs from the loss of their capacity for development.
